prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. The sketch should have a loop (loop_1) that consists of 4 lines (line_1 to line_4). The first line (line_1) starts at [0.0, 0.0] and ends at [0.75, 0.0]. The second line (line_2) starts at [0.75, 0.0] and ends at [0.75, 0.5]. The third line (line_3) starts at [0.75, 0.5] and ends at [0.0, 0.5]. The fourth line (line_4) starts at [0.0, 0.5] and ends at [0.0, 0.0]. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.25 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction. Apply a sketch scale of 0.75. Part 2: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Create a new coordinate system with the same Euler angles and Translation Vector as part 1. The first line (line_1) starts at [0.0, 0.0] and ends at [0.25, 0.0]. The second line (line_2) starts at [0.25, 0.0] and ends at [0.25, 0.5]. The third line (line_3) starts at [0.25, 0.5] and ends at [0.0, 0.5]. The fourth line (line_4) starts at [0.0, 0.5] and ends at [0.0, 0.0]. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.5 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction. Apply a sketch scale of 0.5. Part 3: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0], Translation Vector: [0.5, 0.5, 0.0] Create a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. The fourth line (line_4) starts at [0.0, 0.25] and ends at [0.0, 0.0]. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.375 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction. Apply a sketch scale of 0.25. The final 3D model is a tapered rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, where the top is wider than the bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel to each other, with the dimensions of 2 units by 4 units by 6 units.</description>
